body.p: Hello! My name is Santi, an undergraduate at the University of Central Florida, double majoring in mathematics and computer science. I conduct research at the intersection of pure math and theoretical computer science, with a current focus on programming languages, algebraic topology, and computational complexity.

I'm also an avid listener of music, occasionally performing in piano or concert choir as a tenor II. I've been gradually building up a music portfolio, so if you have any new (or old) sounds you'd like to recommend or are looking for a concert-goer buddy, let me know!

section.title: An Internal Differential Calculus to The Simply-Typed Lambda Calculus
section.meta: Santiago Rodriguez, Steve Zdancewic, Stephen Mell

body.p: Study on continuously differentiable maps over Banach spaces represented as stable maps over coherence spaces. Aims to identify a subset of continuous maps between Banach spaces and typed lambda calculi (denotationally modeled as coherence spaces) which composes to guarantee differentiability.

section.title: Density of Critical Points in Finite-Gap Solutions for the Focusing Nonlinear Schrödinger Equation
section.meta: University of Central Florida, Department of Mathematics

body.p: Analysis on the asymptotics over the distribution of critical points in finite-gap solutions for the fNLS equation. Consequently, provides an estimate on the probability of rogue waves forming in deep-sea conditions.

section.title: A Worlds Account of Thought Experiments
section.meta: University of Central Florida, Department of English

body.p: Proposal on a possible / impossible worlds model for thought experiments. Also, introduces a method for carrying out modal inferences from thought experiments via counterpossible reasoning.
